features: Optical mech switches deliver fast response time for light speed gaming
Frameless design with aircraft grade aluminum faceplate to withstand 100 million keystrokes
IP56 specialized coating and spill resistance for extended durability
Asus Aura Sync RGB lighting features a nearly endless spectrum of colors with the ability to synchronize effects across an ever expanding ecosystem of AURA Sync enabled products
Rog Armory II software for easy customization of buttons, profiles, and adjusting performance or lighting settings
body.description: Arm your battlestations with the TUF Gaming K7 optical-mech keyboard with tactile switch. Enjoy your gaming experience with a detachable wrist rest. Outlast the competition with a specialized durability coating, IP56 spill resistance up to 60ml and customizable aura Sync RGB lighting.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Choose linear or tactile to match your play style, and exploit the compact design to stay in command. K7 is water and dust resistant, topped with aircraft-grade aluminum, comes with a detachable wrist rest and has per-key Aura Sync illumination.

TUF Optical-Mech Switches Each TUF Optical-Mech switch casts a beam of infrared light. Pressing a key links the beam for near-instant actuation. This unique design eliminates the 5ms debounce delay intrinsic to traditional metal contacts, slashing total actuation time to just 0.2ms – so it's quicker than the blink of an eye!

IP56 Water & Dust Resistance TUF Gaming K7 delivers IP56 water and dust resistance. A top plate machined from aircraft-grade aluminum provides stylish exterior strength, and we've even nano-coated the PCB to prevent internal metal parts oxidizing.

Armoury II Armoury II offers more extensive controls while using less system resources. An intuitive UI lets you easily tune TUF Gaming K7 to suit your gameplay – create profiles, customize colors and lighting effects, map keys, record macros and more. You can even track hardware stats during gameplay.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Tuf keyboard, awesome keyboard.
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Speed: I'm a fast typer and I had grown used to slowing down to allow the keyboard to register every keystroke. Not anymore! Now I can type at full blast. Just have to get used to the extremely tall keys.Aesthetics: There are a plethora of RGB settings that include every color and quite a few light show designs. Very pleased. Best of all, on board memory that saves your settings! Don't have to load your clunky program every time you boot up to set lighting settings. Now if only the rest of Aura Sync was this user friendly.Functionality: Crisp keystrokes, very loud keystrokes, nice semi matte finish, wrist rest is a great bonus and kind of needed for these ridiculously tall keys. Seriously everyone, what is with mechanical gaming keyboards and their huge switches. Make them smaller!All of this for a competitive price! Love this keyboard. Thanks Asus. You've made an Asus fanboy out of me.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I didn't know what I was missing.
reviews.reviewText: What can I say, this is an amazing keyboard, the best I've ever typed on. It does remind me of using an old IBM power ball typewriter from high school. Needless to say it isn't the quietest to use, so if loud clicker noises don't sooth you while typing that angry social media post I don't know what will.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great Keyboard, But Mine Has an Extra 4 Key Where the 1 Should Be
reviews.reviewText: It's a very nice, responsive gaming keyboard. The illumination is the best I've ever owned, and I like that it syncs with my ROG STRIX PC. The keys and switches are quality and perform well. They might be a little "clicky" for some people, but I like it.The odd thing with my keyboard was that it had two fours on the ten-key instead of a one, as you can see in the photo. I called ASUS customer service and they said they would send me a "one" when they got some more in. The CS rep said it might be a few months, and I'm coming up on two in a few days. It doesn't affect the performance.My only actual complaints, if you can call them that, is that I wish it had a larger CTRL key like my previous keyboard. It could also be about a half-inch wider on either side. I've got big hands, and I can't get my left wrist all the way on the wrist rest and type at the same time.It is a great keyboard, though, especially since I only paid $79 for it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome keyboard and a must have for those wanting a upgraded keyboard of the future
reviews.reviewText: What can I say, this keyboard is very nice looking by all rights. The keys when pressing are works of art. Doesn't take much to press and the key is either typing your letter or making it's first maneuver is the game you are playing. The magnetic wrist pad is awesome and very comfortable. Looks just like the pictures from ASUS, so I wasn't going to bore you with a picture you have already saw. My last gaming rig I built was back in 2007. This key board is such an upgrade as well, I don't think I'll be enjoying my typing on anything else.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars VERY LOUD KEYSTROKES
reviews.reviewText: Bought for gaming and work, very comfortable handrest. I gave it a three for gaming since the keystrokes could wake the dead. I feel bad for my wife when she's trying to sleep

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars after I downloaded the ARMOURY CRATE software from my ASUS Account after registering my Tuf Product.
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. At First it was tuff and then after that a caught on and set up started out there after

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2021
reviews.reviewText: Can't say many things except I love this keyboard and the only thing missing is USB passthrough

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2019
reviews.reviewText: It clicks and responds so nicely! Feels perfect
Great keyboard. Really enjoy having the magnetic wrist rest. Its so easy to add or remove when needed.
Es una porquería de teclado ve otras opciones, llevo 6 meses con el y ya presento falla y no tiene uso rudo
